info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 30 at 11:36PM CDT until March 31 at 12:30AM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN BALDWIN COUNTY... At 1134 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Silverhill and Magnolia Springs, or near Robertsdale, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations in the warning include Silverhill, Magnolia Springs, and Robertsdale. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. Tornadoes are extremely difficult to see and confirm at night. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. TAKE COVER NOW!
